page.title: 08QUEENIE, QUEENIE
page.content: We play Queenie, Queenie in the playground. It is a game that girls and boys can play. It has a rhyme to go with it. It is a game any amount of children can play. The children are in a line and there is a person on. We 'Dips' to see who is on. The person who is on stands somewhere in the playground and the other people stand behind the person that is on. The person that is on has his back to the other people. He or she throws the ball and someone has to catch it. When they have caught it they sing a rhyme: Queenie, Queenie, Who's got the ball? I haven't got it It isn't in my pocket Queenie, Queenie, Who's got the ball? If the person that is on chooses the right person they are on.
